gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.po
Class PoFetcher

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.impl.open.po.PoFetcher

public class PoFetcher
extends Object

Utility class that fetches PersistentObjects either from the data store or from a global cache.

Method Detail

setCacheSize

public static <K extends Serializable & Comparable<? super K>,P extends PersistentObject<K>> void setCacheSize(Class<P> poClass,
                                                                                                              int maxSize)
Registers a global cache for a PersistentObject class.
If there is already a cache for the same class, then the old class will be replaced by a new empty cache.
When a cache is registered for a class, then the objects of this cache must be usable by different threads, because the cache is static, so the same object could be served to different clients. Modification of a cached object by one thread, will have side effects in a multithreaded environment as a web application.
Persistent classes that require binding of the persistent entity with an instance of the persister are not suitable for being cached in static space. Persistent classes that could have parts of them lazily loaded by an ORM framework fall to this category, because instances of these classes need a persister attached to them in order to deal with lazily loaded parts of the object.

Type Parameters:
K - Type of persistent object key.
P - Type of persistent object
Parameters:
poClass - Class of PersistentObjects being stored in the cache.
maxSize - Maximum size of cache.

setGetChildMethod

public static <K extends Serializable & Comparable<? super K>,P extends PersistentObject<K>,L extends Serializable & Comparable<? super L>,Q extends PersistentObject<L>> void setGetChildMethod(Class<P> poClass,
                                                                                                                                                                                               Class<Q> fatherClass,
                                                                                                                                                                                               String methodName,
                                                                                                                                                                                               String... argNames)
Defines a method of class Q that will fetch instances of class P. If class P is a child of class Q, and class Q has a method that takes one argument of type equal with the type of key of class P, then this method can be used to fetch elements of P.
If Q is PersistentObject and P is PersistentObject and P is a child element of Q, then if Q has a method that takes an element of type K (key type of P), and returns an instance of P, then this method can be used to fetch elements of P.
This feature is useful in the case that a cache has been registered for the type Q. In this case, the elements of P are children of Q and they could be retrieved from their cached Q parent.

Type Parameters:
K -
P -
L -
Q -
Parameters:
poClass -
fatherClass -
methodName -
argNames -

set

public static <K extends Serializable & Comparable<? super K>,P extends PersistentObject<K>> void set(Class<P> poClass,
                                                                                                     P po)
Puts the specified persistent object in the cache, so that future calls to get(clazz,key) will return this element for the specified key. This method is useful in unit testing by putting fixture objects in the cache and thus imitating the behavior of a system that would read these fixtures from the database.

Type Parameters:
K -
P -
Parameters:
poClass - Class of persistent objects.
po - Persistent object to put in the cache.

unload

public static <K extends Serializable & Comparable<? super K>,P extends PersistentObject<K>> void unload(Class<P> poClass,
                                                                                                        P po)
Unloads the given element from the cache.

Parameters:
poClass - of the element
po - to remove.

get

public static <K extends Serializable & Comparable<? super K>,P extends PersistentObject<K>> P get(Class<P> poClass,
                                                                                                  K key)
Fetches the PersistentObject with the specified key. This method delegates the fetch to a PoCache associated with the specified class. If there is no cache already created for the specified class, then a new cache with size 0 is created.

Type Parameters:
K -
P -
Parameters:
poClass - Class of persistent object.
key - Key of the specified persistent object.
Returns:
Returns the cache for the specified class.

getReferenced

public static <K extends Serializable & Comparable<? super K>,P extends PersistentObject<K>,L extends Serializable & Comparable<? super L>,Q extends PersistentObject<L>> Q getReferenced(P po,
                                                                                                                                                                                        Class<Q> refClass)
Fetches a persistent object that is referenced by an other persistent object. If the persistent object type P has a reference to a persistent object R by having the properties of R's key, then this method can be used to fetch the R instance that is referenced by the specified P po.

Type Parameters:
K -
P -
L -
Q -
Parameters:
po - Persistent object that contains a reference to another persistent object's key properties.
refClass - Class of the referenced persistent object.
Returns:
Returns the referenced persistent object.

registerModification

public static void registerModification(Class<?> clazz,
                                        Modification<?> modification)
Registers a modification to be applied to objects of the specified class. Also checks existing caches that might need to be configured with this modification. The latter only happens if a cache does not have a modification and the newly added modification is selected from the registered modifications with the cache's persistent object type.

Parameters:
clazz - Class.
modification - Modification to apply on objects of the specified type.

flushCaches

public static void flushCaches()
Clears all the caches referenced by the PoFetcher.
